so_64690030: How to move certain files from one directory to another, while maintaining directory structure
so_7190965: How to move (and overwrite) all files from one directory to another?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_64690030: #!/bin/bash

SOURCE_DIR=source
DEST_DIR=destination

for txt_file in $(find "${SOURCE_DIR}" -type f -name "*.txt"); do
        new_path=$(dirname "$txt_file" | sed "s~${SOURCE_DIR}~${DEST_DIR}~")
        mkdir -p "${new_path}"
        mv "${txt_file}" "${new_path}"
done

find "${SOURCE_DIR}" -type d -empty -delete

so_22446270: cd /home/user/Desktop/
find . -type d -print0 | xargs -0 -I'{}' echo mkdir -p '/home/user/Documents/{}'
find . -type f -print0 | xargs -0 -I'{}' echo mv '{}' '/home/user/Documents/{}'
